idea-plugin.name: Mako Android Drawable Importer
idea-plugin.description:
Still scaling images manually for Android? Seriously?!

We couldn’t believe it either — it’s 2025 and Android Studio still doesn’t make importing xxxhdpi assets and scaling them down to drawable-* folders (mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi) as effortless as a drag-and-drop.

Enter Mako: the humble, cheerful plugin that does exactly that! Just drop in your xxxhdpi asset, and let Mako scale it down into all the right Android density buckets — all using native Java libraries under the hood. No extra dependencies, just pure, reliable scaling magic.

✨ It even supports WebP (we know, rare right?). We wanted to do JPEG XL too, but hey, support is still catching up.

💻 Built for everyday Android devs. Simple UI. Zero fuss. Maximum satisfaction.

🌍 Localized in English, Chinese, Japanese, Spanish, and Brazilian Portuguese — because image scaling is a universal pain.

🪄 Oh, and did we mention? It’s open source! Star it, fork it, break it (but please open an issue 🙃):
https://github.com/delacrixmorgan/mako-intellij

action.description: Import images from selected folder to Android drawable buckets
